avalancheActivity.comment: A few small avalanches released in the area January 28-30th.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has gained strength in thaw, but new wind slabs can form on top at high elevations. Wet avalanches may then release on Wednesday due to thaw.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow subsided and partly melted in warm weather and rain on 31.1.-1.2. Temperatures at high elevation went above freezing for a time, but part of the precipitation has probably fallen as snow. New wind slabs can form at high elevations the next few days, in various aspects due to variable wind. Another thaw is forecasted on Wednesday, and then wet avalanches become likely.

travelAdvisory.comment: Uncertainty phase due to risk of mass movements still applies in the East fjords but has been lifted for the southern Westfjords and West Iceland. Slush flows have occurred and dlsoed roads in the southern part of the East fjords. Danger phase was lifted in Patreksfjörður this morning but people are advised to show care around streams and pathways. The weather has cooled but temperatures are still above freezing in places. Travelers are encouraged to show care in places where rocks can fall and close to streams and pathways where slush flows can occur.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Uncertainty phase due to risk of mass movements still applies in the East fjords but has been lifted for the southern Westfjords and West Iceland.

weatherForecast.highlights: Breytilegur vindur frá A-N-V á mánudag með rigningu, slyddu og snjókomu. Allhvöss SV átt á þriðjudag með éljum til fjalla. Hlýnar á miðvikudag með rigningu og hvössum suðlægum vindi.

avalancheActivity.comment: Several avalanches fell in the area last week, and while temperatures were rising on Friday January 31st.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New unstable wind slabs can form in snowfall and snowdrift on Monday and Tuesday. We avalanches may then release with in the thaw on Wednesday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow subsided and melted in warm weather and rain on 31.1.-1.2. and should now be homogeneous and stable. Snowfall and snowdrift in variable wind on Monday and Tuesday can form new unstable wind slabs on top of the stable snow. Another thaw is forecasted on Wednesday, and then wet avalanches become likely.

travelAdvisory.comment: Uncertainty phase due to risk of mass movements still applies in the East fjords but has been lifted for the southern Westfjords and West Iceland. Slush flows have occurred and dlsoed roads in the southern part of the East fjords. Danger phase was lifted in Patreksfjörður this morning but people are advised to show care around streams and pathways. The weather has cooled but temperatures are still above freezing in places. Travelers are encouraged to show care in places where rocks can fall and close to streams and pathways where slush flows can occur.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Uncertainty phase due to risk of mass movements still applies in the East fjords but has been lifted for the southern Westfjords and West Iceland.

weatherForecast.highlights: Snjókoma í hvössum NA-NV-V áttum á mánudag. S-SV éljagangur á þriðjudag. Hlýnar á miðvikudag með rigningu og hvössum suðlægum vindi.

avalancheActivity.highlights: A significant amount of snow has melted due to thawing and strong winds on Friday and Saturday.  Wind slabs may form on northerly aspects on Sunday and Monday as snowfall continues in southerly winds.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A significant amount of snow has melted due to warm and strong winds on Friday and Saturday. Temperatures have reached close to 10°C at mountain elevations, and the snowpack is expected to have become relatively isothermal, strengthening once freezing. Wet snow avalanches may have occurred widely during the peak of the warm spell, and there is a risk of avalanches while freezing has not occurred. Wind slabs may form on Sunday and Monday as snowfall continues in southerly winds.

travelAdvisory.comment: Uncertainty phase due to risk of mass movements still applies in the East fjords but has been lifted for the southern Westfjords and West Iceland. Slush flows have occurred and dlsoed roads in the southern part of the East fjords. Danger phase was lifted in Patreksfjörður this morning but people are advised to show care around streams and pathways. The weather has cooled but temperatures are still above freezing in places. Travelers are encouraged to show care in places where rocks can fall and close to streams and pathways where slush flows can occur.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Uncertainty phase due to risk of mass movements still applies in the East fjords but has been lifted for the southern Westfjords and West Iceland.

weatherForecast.highlights: Aðfaranótt mánudags snjóar í austanátt á svæðinu. Á mánudag hvessir allverulega og snýr í suðlægar áttir og hlýnar með rigningu á láglendi snjókomu til fjalla.

avalancheActivity.comment: Wet avalanches have likely released in the mountains during warming on Friday and Saturday. Slush flows released onto roads in southern East fjords.
avalancheActivity.highlights: A significant amount of snow has melted due to warm temperatures and rain on Friday and Saturday. Wind slabs may form during southerly snow fall Sunday night but wet avalanches might occur during warming and rain on Monday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A significant amount of snow has melted due to warm temperatures and rain on Friday and Saturday. Wind slabs may form during southerly snow fall Sunday night but wet avalanches might occur during warming and rain on Monday. After very warm weather in the area the snow pack is expected to have subsided and is likely isothermal in upper elevations.

travelAdvisory.comment: Uncertainty phase due to risk of mass movements still applies in the East fjords but has been lifted for the southern Westfjords and West Iceland. Slush flows have occurred and dlsoed roads in the southern part of the East fjords. Danger phase was lifted in Patreksfjörður this morning but people are advised to show care around streams and pathways. The weather has cooled but temperatures are still above freezing in places. Travelers are encouraged to show care in places where rocks can fall and close to streams and pathways where slush flows can occur.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Uncertainty phase due to risk of mass movements still applies in the East fjords but has been lifted for the southern Westfjords and West Iceland.

weatherForecast.highlights: Á sunnudagskvöld og fram á mánudag má búast við töluverðri snjókomu til fjalla fyrst um sinn sem þróast yfir í rigningu í neðri hluta fjalla á mánudagsmorgun. Áframhaldandi SV-hvassviðri og úrkoma fram á kvöld.
